message: I've tried several auto close plugins (automatically closes parens, quotes, etc as you type) but the main problem I have with almost all of them is that sometimes I'd like to only put the opening paren without the close paren and when I try to delete the second paren it deletes the first one too. It seems the only way to get around it is to put a space and then delete the two characters.  Anyone out there already solved this? How?
You can bypass the plugin's action by typing C-v before opening a paren, brace, quote,etc
Thank you! That helps.  Wonder if there is a plugin that's just smarter about it, like Textmate was.
I use this auto close plugin and I don't have this problem: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2009
